result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty for Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was dismissed and read in on January 11, 2016.  Case called for sentencing purposes on defendant's other pending cases 15CF120 and 15CF2010.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  No appearance by the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has pending cases, defense counsel indicates this case is part of a global resolution.    Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing in cases 15CF120 and 15CF2010.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.    Filed, signed Felony Scheduling Order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26, Room 634 Courthouse.  Parties select scheduling date before Branch 26.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  
Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defendant not produced; appearance waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  

***Parties advised that per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, effective October 31, 2015 this case is reassigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30.***

Defense submits request for substitution form at this time.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl for Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record. Court will be proceeding to trial in another matter. Court orders case adjourned for status conference.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  
Count 3 to reflect Bail Jumping (Felony), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b) and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.
Count 4 to reflect: Obstructing an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1) and 939.51(34)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Amended Criminal Complaint from the State received and filed.  
Amended Criminal Complaint adds Count 3 and Count 4.

Count 3: Bail Jumping (Felony)
Count 4: Obstructing and Officer
from the State received and filed.
from the State received and filed.
Notice of motion and motion to amend the Complaint and Information from the State received and filed.
from the State received and filed.
State's motion for joinder of cases for trial received and filed.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for final pretrial in cases 15CF120,15CF2010 and 15CF2103. Court holds conference in chambers off the record. Matter is called on the record.  Counsel hears argument re: State's motion for joinder. Court GRANTS motion. State requests leave to amend charges, Court hears argument. Court GRANTS request of the State, arraignment to be held on trial date. Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/12/15 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel is requesting additional final pretrial date. Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/12/15 at 9:30am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9.18.15 and for jury trial on 10.12.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the Amended Criminal Complaint with the defendant. Defendant informed that while the facts listed in the Amended Criminal Complaint are different than in the original Criminal Complaint, the charges remain the same. Defense counsel waived formal reading. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case numbers 08JV714 and 15CF2010 and that are attached to the complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Phillip Ferguson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Amended Criminal Complaint received and filed.
Counts 1 and 2 remain the same as listed in the original Criminal Complaint however, the facts listed are different.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, defendant in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Hailstock contacted the Court this morning to inform the Court that he would not be able to appear this afternoon. State was notified.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
